text: Regions of the brain affected by prolonged use of addictive substances are involved in which processes (among others)?
Which agent is combined with naloxone to help treat opioid addiction?
_____________ is a natural opioid/are natural opioids produced in the body.
______________ is the neurotransmitter associated with feelings of pleasure.
Tolerance is defined as:
answers: A variety of unpleasant symptoms occurring after the use of opioids is reduced or stopped
A condition in which higher doses of opioids are required to produce the same effects as during initial use
The recurrence of opioid use after a period of abstinence
An adaptive physiological state occurring with regular opioid use that results in a withdrawal syndrome if opioid use is stopped
correct_answers: A condition in which higher doses of opioids are required to produce the same effects as during initial use

text: Suboxone sublingual tablets contain buprenorphine, a partial agonist at the mu-opioid receptor, and naloxone, an antagonist at the mu-opioid receptor.
Which of the following screening tools takes less than a minute to administer and is scored instantaneously?
Which of the following agents is administered on a once-monthly schedule?
Methadone is a _______________.
Buprenorphine is a(n) _______________.
Methadone is a _____________________ narcotic.
What is the route of administration for methadone?
Buprenorphine is a ____________ narcotic.
Which of the following is a behavioral treatment goal?
Oral naltrexone is indicated for the treatment of opioid dependence.
Which of the following are indications for VIVITROL? (Select all that apply.)
answers: The treatment of alcohol tolerance as part of a comprehensive management program that includes psychosocial support

The treatment of alcohol dependence in patients who are able to abstain from alcohol in an outpatient setting prior to initiation of treatment with VIVITROL; Patients should not be actively drinking at the time of initial VIVITROL administration
The prevention of relapse to opioid dependence following opioid detoxification
VIVITROL should be part of a comprehensive management program that includes psychosocial support
correct_answers: The treatment of alcohol dependence in patients who are able to abstain from alcohol in an outpatient setting prior to initiation of treatment with VIVITROL; Patients should not be actively drinking at the time of initial VIVITROL administration
The prevention of relapse to opioid dependence following opioid detoxification
VIVITROL should be part of a comprehensive management program that includes psychosocial support

Which of the following is one of the warnings and precautions for VIVITROL is for:
Approximately how many alcohol dependent and opioid dependent patients were treated with VIVITROL in the controlled and uncontrolled premarketing VIVITROL studies?
In the controlled clinical trial, which adverse event led to more dropouts of alcohol dependent patients in the VIVITROL 380 mg group than in the placebo treated group?
What percentage of opioid dependent patients treated with VIVITROL in the controlled trial discontinued treatment due to an adverse event?
VIVITROL is an opioid:
Which of the following is true about VIVITROL?
answers: Plasma concentrations of VIVITROL are highest 14 days after administration
VIVITROL plasma concentration rapidly decline after 3 days
VIVITROL is a rapid-release formulation and is administered weekly
Plasma concentrations of VIVITROL peak after 2 hours and again after 2 to 3 days
correct_answers: Plasma concentrations of VIVITROL peak after 2 hours and again after 2 to 3 days

text: The elimination half-life of naltrexone following VIVITROL administration is _____ days and is dependent on the erosion of the polymer.
VIVITROL is metabolized by P450 enzymes and therefore has a high potential for interaction with other drugs
